description.narrative: Expanding access of finance to SMEs: SMEs contribute significantly to China''s GDP growth but have been under-served by commercial banks. The growth of JFLC, an SME focused leasing company, can help address the SMEs'' financing difficulty by providing flexible alternative channels; Supporting economic growth in frontier regions: Frontier regions have much lower financial service penetration in China. In light of the credit tightening in China, leasing addresses the local demand for funding, supports the continued growth of local economy, and thus mitigates widening gap between frontier regions and coastal regions; Promoting the development of the leasing sector: Leasing penetration is only 3.8% in China. IFC''s further investment in JFLC will have a strong development impact in promoting the development of leasing sector in China. JFLC has maintained a sound business record and is expected to further improve its risk management capability. JFLC could become a model institution for other leasing companies to emulate, with a demonstration effect to stimulate the healthy development for the entire leasing sector.

The proposed project will likely consist of IFC loan financings in RMB to Jiangsu Financial Leasing Co., Ltd (JFLC or the Company) to support its business growth and improve its financing structure. JFLC, established in June 1985, is a leading financial leasing company in China and an existing IFC client.
